attributes.action: Give all teenagers aged under 18 on 23.6.16 a vote in a supplemental referendum.
attributes.background: Allowing teenagers to vote in a supplementary EU referendum will be good for the future of Britain’s democracy, because whatever the final outcome they will have had the opportunity to participate in the decision. Their votes can be added to the June ballot and the result recalculated.

attributes.action: Offer British citizenship to Polish nationals resident in the UK on June 23 2016
attributes.background: The Polish people are longstanding & valued friends and allies of the UK, and we have deep ties which exceed and excel any EU links. We hereby petition the UK Government to extend an offer of automatic British Citizenship to all Polish nationals resident in the UK on June 23rd 2016.
attributes.additional_details:
We deeply regret the sense of insult felt by the Polish nation resulting from the referendum decision to leave the EU. We wish to repair our relationship. We wish to recognise the outstanding contribution to peace of the Free Polish Army, and to reassure the UK's widespread, well integrated, Polish-heritage communities, which in many cases pre-date the formation of the EU. 

http://www.bbc.co.uk/history/familyhistory/bloodlines/migration.shtml?entry=polish_free_forces&theme=migration

attributes.action: Nationally standardise the colours of commercial and domestic rubbish bins.
attributes.background: Each council area has a different colour scheme for rubbish and recycling bins. This often adds to confusion over what can be recycled, and recyclable waste is often thrown away, or recyclable materials are often put in the incorrect bins.
attributes.additional_details:
The colour scheme would become second nature to people's views towards waste disposal. The colour scheme could even extend to public litter bins on the streets.

Whilst this process could take some time, it could be implemented in a phased way, as and when bins are scheduled for routine replacement.

attributes.action: End Taxpayer Bail-outs of Banks by removing limitation of shareholder liability.
attributes.background: Between 2007 and 2010 the British Taxpayer bailed out the banks and bankers with cash and guarantees totalling £1,162 BILLION, equivalent to almost 3 times the total NHS budget for the same 4-year period! (Source: NAO; https://www.nao.org.uk/highlights/taxpayer-support-for-uk-banks-faqs/)
attributes.additional_details: The remedy is to ensure that shareholders are on the hook for all the banks' liabilities without a taxpayer safety net. They will then hold bank directors and management to account and monitor risk to prevent recurrences of such disasters. To achieve this, Parliament should remove shareholders' limited liability in banks (and any other business deemed too big to fail), so that shareholders, not taxpayers, are liable for all the banks' liabilities. There can be no reasonable objection to this.

attributes.action: Europeans in the UK for more than 10 years should be given British citizenship.
attributes.background:
We need to demonstrate that leaving the EU will not develop xenophobic reteric in the country,which can not be controlled.
There are lots of Europeans who are keeping this country running, in the health services and caring professions who are scared they will be kicked out due to the result.

attributes.action:
Brighton out of Britain.
Give Brighton and Hove its independence from Britain.
attributes.background: Brighton and Hove has long been a liberal land at odds with the country it resides in. This has been shown many times in our recent voting past. This has now again been highlighted in the recent brexit vote. We want to remain in Europe and continue to thrive in a time of globalisation.

attributes.action: Reform our parliamentary system in the wake of the UK's vote for independence.
attributes.background: One argument put forward by the Leave campaign was that the EU was undemocratic. This message undoubtedly struck a chord with many voters who feel disenfranchised. Yet Brexit will not solve this since our parliamentary system remains inherently unrepresentative for the following reasons:
attributes.additional_details:
- The House of Lords is unelected.
- First Past the Post is unrepresentative. UKIP (3881129) and Greens (1157613) needed vastly more voters per MP than Labour (40290) or Conservatives (34245) (https://www.opendemocracy.net/ourkingdom/liam-anderson/voters-per-mp-why-first-past-post-failed).

The following should happen before the next election:
- The House of Lords be replaced with an elected Second Chamber.
- A debate (and possible referendum) over the best voting system (PR, STV, AV+, FPTP).

attributes.action: Change the law to clarify election expenses and end the current controversy.
attributes.background:
The government should end the current controversy over allegations of electoral fraud by changing the law such that the rules are made unambiguous.
If the party in question apologises for the mistake and the affected members step down there should be no need for expensive investigations.
attributes.additional_details:
Either this issue stems from an honest mistake or it does not.
If it is an honest mistake then the only reasonable course of action is to own up and try to set it straight.
If it is not an honest mistake, then it appears to be a callous and calculated plot perpetrated by a corruption that runs through the heart of the party.

attributes.action: The Government to start an official trial on the safety of e-cig/vape products
attributes.background: I have been a vaper for 6 years and feel much better than when I was a smoker.  I have not even had a cold for 3 years which means no trips to the doctors or prescriptions!!
attributes.additional_details: Although there may be dodgy products on the market...this can equate to dodgy iPhone chargers.  Exploding batteries....ever heard of mobile phones exploding/setting on fire.  E-cigs/vaping products need to be officially tested and for the scare tactics to stop once and for all

attributes.action:
Petition Minister of Health -
Establish Hospice Suites in NHS Hospitals
attributes.background: The current Office of National Statistics survey of End of Life Care, ‘Voices’, shows 96% of the dying strongly prefer home care or some more private and congenial place to die than the wards of a Hospital. Only 3% prefer Hospital yet half of deaths annually in England will occur on the wards.
attributes.additional_details:
Hospice care is the ‘centre of excellence’ for palliative care but most of us will die on the wards. We could have privacy, dignity and specialised care in Hospice Suites requiring reorganisation rather than more resources to establish.  

A recent Select Committee hearing had an NHS spokesman claiming this provision would reduce the skills of generalist Nurses and Doctors,  as if patients exist only to provide practical experience for medical staff. The dying should enjoy the best we can provide.

attributes.action: Cap CSA payments at set weekly amount regardless of income.
attributes.background: CSA payments are currently worked out based on the ex partners income. If you're on benefits you pay £5 per week. If you're earning £36,000 per year it goes to over £100 per week for a child and continues going up with each pound earned. Cap the CSA payments to child benefit amounts!
attributes.additional_details: CSA payment calculator. Works out 15% of gross income for one child, 17% for 2 children and 19% for 3 or more children. On £36,000 per year for 3 children this is £567 per month. Leaving the payee with £1700 per month to live on. This is unfair on the payee.

attributes.action: Stop 39 week waiting period for mortgage interest payments
attributes.background:
From 1/04/16 the government has implemented a 39 week waiting period for mortgage interest payment support. 
This means that people like myself who have always worked and paid into the system but now can not work through no fault of their own such as cancer risk losing their property
attributes.additional_details:
From 1 April 2016 the waiting period until you receive any payment will increase from 13 to 39 weeks for new claims.Reference DWP website
Support for Mortgage Interest (SMI) https://www.gov.uk/support-for-mortgage-interest/overview

attributes.action: Reinstate the weekly Widows' Pension (abolished in April 2001)
attributes.background: The weekly Widows' Pension was abolished in April 2001 and now the Conservative Government are delaying the payment of our State Pension which we and our employers have paid into and which is rightfully ours.

attributes.action: Make it law that all ice rinks make you wear crash helmets and elbow protection.
attributes.background:
As a child growing up going ice skating i never wore crash helmets or elbow protection. 
As a adult taking my own children I have not made them either wear protection whilst Ice Skating, but when they go doughnutting they do wear crash helmets Recently i suffered a head injury ice skating.
attributes.additional_details:
I fell smashed my head on the Ice and have been suffering server concussion for 3 weeks and still recovering,So the last 3 weeks my 4 children , grandma and my husband all have to look after me as I have not been able to do anything . 

Please read about concussion and sign the petition keep all our children and parents safe . Thank you for your time

attributes.action: Review extra funding for m60 ring road and m56 and other adjoining motorways
attributes.background: Traffic chaos all around m60 ring road ever y day adding as much as 2 hours on to the journey , major problems Include m56 junctions 3 to 1 heading East to m60 anticlockwise at junction 3 cheadle
attributes.additional_details: M56 narrows to 2 lanes to join m60 4lanes to 2 causes bottleneck and traffic increasing up to 500,000 annually , nationally

attributes.action: Abolish the 1 hour clock changes in March and October and introduce double BST
attributes.background:
The clocks going back in October is shown to increase road accidents, crime, and mental health conditions such as SAD due to the darker nights. 
Double BST would put us at GMT+1 in winter, and GMT+2 in summer, bringing us into line with Europe.
attributes.additional_details:
According to the RoSPA, more people are killed and injured in road accidents due to the darker Autumn and winter evenings. 
Cambridge university estimates 450,000 tonnes of carbon emissions saved per year. 
It would align the UK with European times, aiding businesses. 
It would boost tourism that is dependent on daylight hours by up to two months a year. 
It would shift the average year long sunset time from 18:35 to 19:30, giving an average of 55minutes per day of extra light in the evenings.

attributes.action: all road traffic accidents with police attendance should have a written report
attributes.background: 18 months ago I was knocked off my motorbike whilst filtering slow moving traffic by somebody who went to change lane without indicating, and with no police report and a witness who doesn't seem to want to give a statement I'm struggling to prove the events with my insurance company.
attributes.additional_details: The day after my accident I called the police and spoke to the attending officer who confirmed I was knocked off whilst filtering and the other driver had attempted to change lane without indicating. I also called the witness who confirmed that I was travelling in a safe manner and the other driver swerved to change lane without indicating and obviously being unaware of his surroundings and myself.

attributes.action: Preserve all existing rights of UK citizens to Freedom of Movement in the EU
attributes.background: The EU Referendum text did not instruct the Government to sign away UK citizens' current rights to travel, reside, work, study, or retire freely anywhere in the EU, without discrimination. Though on Brexit we lose EU citizenship, the Govt. has a duty to preserve our rights in its Brexit Agreement.
attributes.additional_details:
These Factsheets summarise your current rights of Free Movement 1) as EU citizens, & 2) via UK membership of the Single Market. You will lose these rights unless they are protected. 

1) Free Movement of Persons: (skip the Schengen section) http://www.europarl.europa.eu/atyourservice/en/displayFtu.html?ftuId=FTU_2.1.3.html 
2) Free Movement of Workers: (different emphasis: this is oriented to the Single Market): http://www.europarl.europa.eu/atyourservice/en/displayFtu.html?ftuId=FTU_3.1.3.html

attributes.action: Legalize Cannabis Oil and use it in the NHS to help people suffering from Cancer
attributes.background: Cannabis Oil itself is able to cure Cancer and there is enough evidence and research to prove so. if this was legalized and put into the NHS,the amount of patients suffering from cancer would decrease and would effectively save people from Cancer.
attributes.additional_details:
also, the reason that cannabis oil (from cannabis) is not used to cure and kill cancer because it is a plant, and cannot be patented, which means pharmaceutical companies cannot make profit off it.

http://www.mirror.co.uk/news/world-news/government-finally-admits-cannabis-kills-6303176

https://www.cancertutor.com/index8/

http://www.cureyourowncancer.org/how-cannabis-oil-works.html

attributes.action: A newborn baby to be screened for Krabbe Disease
attributes.background: I have a best friend that tried years to get pregnant. When she finally become pregnant she was over the moon. She then become pregnant with her second child which was then found out to have Krabbe Disease at 13 months old which there is currently no cure for and they don't screen for when born.
attributes.additional_details: In America they screen newborn babies for Krabbe Disease but not in the uk. This is a very serious condition which there is no cure. It is a gene which one or both parents carry and can pass it on to the child without even knowing. If it's not found early enough then a child can die by the age of two years with late onset Krabbe Diease. This needs to become part of screening with a newborn ASAP. Please help make this happen!!

attributes.action: Make prescriptions free for people with Crohns, Ulcerative Colitis
attributes.background: I suffer with this and I have to pay £104 a year for medication and that's with a prepayment prescription card. I can't live without this medication and I can get extremely poorly to the point hospital is required. I think this should be made free.

attributes.action: Make patent infringement a criminal offence in the UK.
attributes.background: Patent infringement is commonplace. Personally and according to the Intellectual Property's Office's opinion I have experienced this directly.  However, as individual or small business trying to stop such trespass the cost is prohibitive as the penalties for unauthorised IPR's use is insufficient.
attributes.additional_details: Innovators who develop products look to protect such technology.  Enjoying rewards from inspiration made real are huge motivators. However, it is true to say, "patents are not worth the paper they are written on if not policed".  Unauthorised patent use is crushing for those who lack means. Business know this and take comfort at little or no penalty for their actions.  Our world is built on ideas, so why do we not protect the innovators? Steal the idea, steals the motivation and steals growth.

attributes.action: Stop the proposed closure of wards at Cheadle, Staffordshire, hospital.
attributes.background: The closure of wards will result in local residents having to travel long distances to other hospitals - mainly to the Royal Stoke hospital which is already under extreme pressure from the sheer volume of patients.
attributes.additional_details: Royal Stoke hospital lacks parking for visitors - Cheadle is well provided for parking spaces. It is also well run and well liked by local residents.

attributes.action: Return the District Councils to Cornwall
attributes.background:
Since Cornwall Council was formed it has wasted so much money. 

It is time for the government to return Cornwall to District Councils and to abolish Cornwall Council.

attributes.action: Make a&e more equipped with private room& bathroom when dealing with miscarriage
attributes.background: Its the most horrific experience for a women and her partner to go throught and should be dealt with respectful no women should have to sit in a room full of people or have to clean herself up in a dirty bathroom that drunks go in in a&e

attributes.action: Acknowledge the loss of our friend Harambe, and issue a statement of regret
attributes.background: Harambe was a proud, benevolent, and majestic creature. Closely related to we humans, we should mourn the passing of this loving being appropriately. His death will not be in vain. He died as he lived, protecting the innocent, and showing us all how to live our own lives. An inspiration.
attributes.additional_details: Harambe was gunned down in cold blood, on May 28th 2016. He was just seventeen years old. Harambe was agitated by the crowd baying for his blood, even as Primatologist Jane Goodall opined that he was trying to protect the poor child involved (http://www.janegoodall.org/wp-content/uploads/2796_001.pdf).

attributes.action: Make it compulsory to fly the Union Flag on all public buildings.
attributes.background: The UK appears to have a most disgraceful fear of displaying our national flag on public buildings, on the grounds of either some misplaced sense of danger under health & safety legislation or for fear of offending some minority group.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK is one of the only countries in the world where the flying of the national flag is actively discouraged by local councils and governmental bodies. This is a national & international disgrace.

The UK has decided that it no longer wishes to be politically associated with our European neighbours, rather to display our independence. Yet we are actively discouraged from showing our national flag as a symbol of that very independence.

attributes.action: Introducing funding to help those with mental health issues.
attributes.background: There are many people in the UK that are experiencing mental health issues. This is a problem as people are still suffering from theses issues and not had the support needed. This has caused people to be in a worse situation than they would of if the had the support in the first place.
attributes.additional_details: This is important to me as i am experiencing this myself. I am wanting to change this  and stop making people waiting for professional help and get the qualified people in. By raising awareness we can make those vulnerable people and their friends and families feel they are not alone and make more peoples lives better. This can be done with more advertisement, more qualified professionals to set up more social action projects and one to one appointments.

attributes.action: Increase the minimum wages for 17-20 year olds.
attributes.background: National minimum wage for 17-20 year old's should be increased, wages they receive are not just. Being a 20 year old earning £5.50 p/h is inadequate, knowing how much effort and sacrifice you put into working alongside studying. Yet we are liable for paying adult fares on public transport.

attributes.action: Compulsory educational visits to The battle of the Somme and Churchill's bunkers
attributes.background: I feel that children have very little knowledge about the sacrifices soldiers made for our country and why we should always take time to remember them as a mark of respect. It should become part of the curriculum for history and geography.

attributes.action: Don't implement GCSE exam 9-1 grades, instead have A*, A, B*, B, C*, C, D, E, F.
attributes.background: The justification for swapping from A*-G to 9-1 can be found on the gov.uk webpage in additional details. After reading it I hope you agree it will just serve to cause massive confusion for employers & students. The system I propose keeps the the new 9 grades but is comparable to existing ones.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.gov.uk/government/news/setting-standards-for-new-gcses-in-2017

http://www.theguardian.com/education/2015/jun/02/ofqual-survey-finds-wide-confusion-and-doubts-about-gcse-and-a-level-changes

https://www.tes.com/news/school-news/breaking-news/teachers-confused-over-new-numerical-gcse-grading-system

attributes.action: Make sanitary bins in male toilets compulsory for the transgender community.
attributes.background: I would like male toilets to have sanitation bins as the transgender community will be able to feel more comfortable and not have to use the female toilets if they are menstruating. This will promote self esteem among the transgender community.
attributes.additional_details: As gender neutral toilets are gradually coming into place, I believe it is very appropriate that the transgender community is made to feel as comfortable as they can be. The cost of the sanitation bins are very little and extremely convenient. The bins will be used if the trans* man is menstruating. He will then be able to use the male bathroom and feel comfortable doing so.

attributes.action: If Brexit happens. All previous EU spending should be forced to go to the NHS.
attributes.background: The Leave campaign made promises that the money spent in the EU would go to the NHS. They should be forced to up keep that promise.

attributes.action: No general election until after Brexit
attributes.background: We call on the next Tory leader not to call a general election and concentrate on brexit and make the divorce from the EU smooth as possible

attributes.action: The Government to discuss increase in racism brought about by the referrendum.
attributes.background:
There have been worringly increasing reports about the rise in racism since the referrendum has started and appears to have become worse since the UK voted to leave.
The UK is a multi-cultural nation and no-one should be made to feel subordinate or threatened in they're home.
attributes.additional_details: Bbc news 'go back home' article

attributes.action: Hold a vote to find out if the country wants a second EU referendum
attributes.background: The Leave campaign has distanced itself from their pre-referendum statements, has no post referendum plan and many people who voted out have changed their mind. We, the undersigned feel that this would be the only democratic route to gauge opinion and offer a way to unite the country once again.

attributes.action: To revoke the Barnett Formula for Scotland
attributes.background: Scotland has an unfair advantage due to the excessive money given to Scotland by the Barnett Formula. They use this to spend in uncontrolled ways, i.e. Free prescriptions and tuition fees.  This is grossly unfair to the people of England and should be stopped with immediate effect.

attributes.action:
Non Negotiable for BREXIT
No free movement for work, NO free NHS, No Benefits.
attributes.background: Our local communities are getting destroyed by these mass unskilled EU immigration which is putting pressure on schools, NHS. housing, work and more important our quality of life. We want immigration which we need to progress in the world. We cant open borders for abuse by EU migrants for benefits.
attributes.additional_details:
The country has voted to LEAVE the EU due to David Cameron's failure and promise to renegotiate with the EU and all the key basic requirements been watered down.

We now want the any future UK Govt to respect and honour the wishes of British people to renegotiate with the EU on the basis of referendum with (Non Negotiable for BREXIT)
No free movement for work, NO free NHS, No access to any benefits.

We dont want future UK Govt to water down these main issues for other concessions from the EU.

attributes.action: Hold an EU referendum where it is illegal  to knowingly misrepresent the facts
attributes.background: Many people voted in The EU referendum based on statements which campaign Leaders have admitted were mistakes.  We believe there would have been a different outcome if it was illegal to make false representations to the public and call on the outcome to be set aside and a new referendum to be held

attributes.action: Refrain from triggering Article 50 until trade deals negotiated.
attributes.background: if Britain triggers Article 50 before the Government has successfully negotiated the terms of any trade treaties with the EU and all other major economies of the world it is likely to back us into a corner from which there is no return.
attributes.additional_details: Whilst Europe will want to trade with us it is not going to do so at the risk of further destabilising the EU. Trade figures clearly demonstrate that we need EU trade more than it needs ours. We will be negotiating with an EU that will have little sympathy for our position and every reason to make an example of us in order to prevent other EU member states contemplating a similar move. To invoke Article 50 before establishing the trading terms could well be political suicide.

attributes.action: David Cameron should not invoke Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty immediately
attributes.background: The UK has voted to Leave the EU. The vote is not legally binding and UK Parliament is sovereign. David Cameron does not have to invoke article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty, giving our intention to leave the EU immediately. He should use the Leave vote as a negotiating tool and then hold a 2nd referendum

attributes.action: Remove the titles Mrs, Miss and Ms from all government forms.
attributes.background: Titles for women are sexist and discriminatory, and provide marital status information about them that men do not have to divulge. Even having the Ms option gives some people a preconception about that person. All titles fields should be removed from document and computer forms.

attributes.action: Pass a law prohibiting or limiting referendums
attributes.background:
Parliament should pass a law either prohibiting referendums or requiring that the result that would change the status quo would need to achieve more than two-thirds of the votes cast to pass.

The current EU referendum demonstrates that too often they are - disruptive, divisive and distracting.
attributes.additional_details:
We live in a representative democracy. It is important that people have a say in their own government but it is equally important that we avoid a tyranny of the majority and that on particular issues voting proceeds on the basis of knowledge and understanding. Representative democracy, for all its flaws, achieves that goal better than any referendum can.

Meanwhile the referendum process distracts from other issues, falsely turns complex questions into binary choices and fosters division.

attributes.action: Give domiciliary carers car maintenance funds per year.
attributes.background: I am carer in the community and my wages just about cover fuel and bills. I love my job but many of us carers cant pay for the wear and tear, that the daily usage is damaging our cars, by using it for up to 12hrs a day.
attributes.additional_details: I have found no extra help of funding/loans to help me get my car fixed and risk loosing my job

attributes.action: Ban residential bonfires during Summer.
attributes.background:
We don't get too many sunny days in the UK, but when we do you know someone locally will be having a bonfire! 

I want to petition the government to stop residential bonfires during the summer months from when the clocks go forward until the clocks go back.

attributes.action: Ban MMA and regulate the beauty industry with checks from local councils
attributes.background:
MMA causes injuries and health problems. Beauty therapists are not currently checked for accredited qualifications, insurance and hygiene.
This has led to numerous reports of injuries and litigation that could be avoided with regular checks and a formal register.

attributes.action: Reform the House of Lords to become the revising chamber of devolved assemblies
attributes.background: To reform the House of Lords to become the revising chamber for every devolved Parliament and Assembly in the United Kingdom to promote good governance while reducing the future burden on the taxpayers of the Realm with unnecessary duplication across the nation.

attributes.action: Let all serving forces personnel grow a full beard.
attributes.background: Using the same guidelines as the Royal Navy, allow all serving personnel for all UK forces to grow and maintain a beard.

attributes.action: Change the law to make cyber-bullying a criminal offence
attributes.background:
This petition is change the law, to make cyber-bullying a criminal offence, with specific minimum punishments for those convicted.
With social media becoming the main portal for people to share their lives with others, cyber bullying is on the increase.
attributes.additional_details: Cyber bullies must face harsher punishments. With self harming and suicide on the rise, social media truly does play a part with it being noted that all teenagers who socialise online will come across cyber bullying at least once. However, it is not just teenagers who are subjected to this online torture, with the internet becoming the new venue to host the modern day witch hunt. It is time that cyber bullies were held accountable and suitably sentenced for their actions.

attributes.action: Ban real animal fur from being sold in the UK
attributes.background:
Animals are being cruelly killed for their skin. These animals include; elephants, salt water crocs, snakes, foxes, wolves. 
The super rich including rappers, pop stars buy these skins in the form of coats, handbags and trainers. Some of these animals are skinned alive.
attributes.additional_details: Reggie yates documentary, Kim Kardashian
